Subject: 4-14-16 Shift4/Lighthouse Transaction Network Outage @ 13:43 EST - Root Cause Analysis & Resolution- FINAL

All,

Attached is the detailed RCA for Thursday's service interruption event as well as the resolution and steps we will
take going forward. I have also included some responses to Dave's questions from our earlier email chain.

- Root Cause: Defect in code to compensate for leap second.
- Resolution: We rolled back to the prior (good) version of software.
- Steps going Forward: We have a process in place for testing releases. This error occurred because of an unusual
circumstance (leap second) and the team overlooked this condition in their test plan. We will be calling a meeting
with the tech team to discuss the addition of leap second to the network test plan.

Please let me know if you have any additional questions.

Operational Impact:
• How long were merchants down: The outage lasted from 13:43 to 15:45.
• How many merchants were affected? At the time of the outage, there were 6,853 active merchants.
• What percentage of merchants were affected? 100% of those processing at that time through the affected
server.
• Service Level Agreement (SLA) Credits: We do not offer credits far system uptime.

Communication:
• How did we communicate with the merchants: We published a banner on the merchant and reseller portals
and reached out via direct email.
• Did we communicate to-merchants timely: Yes. The first banner was posted at 14:52 EST, about an hour
after the start of the outage.
• How did Shift4 communicate to their Resellers/Partners/ISV's: We spoke to many partners on the phone,
sent direct emails, and posted real-time updates to the status banners (including the root cause).

Business Impact:
•	Financial impact: The financial impact was minimal. There was a dip in transactions on Thursday when
comparing day over day data but we have already seen those transactions begin to trend back upward.

We consider this matter closed and will circle up internally with the technology team on Monday morning.

Thank you
